definition: variant of 策劃|策划[ce4 hua4]

policy/plan/scheme/bamboo slip for writing (old)/to whip (a horse)/to encourage/riding crop with sharp spines (old)/essay written for the imperial examinations (old)/upward horizontal stroke in calligraphy
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]

sentences.english: The demonstration was carefully orchestrated to attract maximum publicity.
sentences.chinese: 该示威经过精心策画以尽量吸引公众注重。

sentences.english: How ca very you design your Business Model ?
sentences.chinese: 什么是商业模式如何策画？

sentences.english: May I arrange the time and the place, pleautomotive service engineers?
sentences.chinese: 能不能让我策画时间和场所？

sentences.english: Determined not to care, Gilly engineers her own rescue.
sentences.chinese: 坚决的不去关心，吉莉策画营救她自己。

sentences.english: In the election of a wife, as in a project of war, to err but once is to be undone for ever.
sentences.chinese: 选择妻子也象策画战争，一时之错将成终身之恨。

sentences.english: They are scheming to get her elected as leader.
sentences.chinese: 他们正策画让她当选领导。

sentences.english: The Analyze By option allows calculation of spatial statistics at either the Landscape or Class level.
sentences.chinese: 该参数用于选择在景观还是类型标准上的统计策画。

sentences.english: By careful strategy she negotiated a substantial pay rise.
sentences.chinese: 她精心策画后，谈妥了大幅增加工资的事。

definition: variant of 計劃|计划[ji4 hua4]
variant of 保鏢|保镖[bao3 biao1]
to come up with an idea/generation of ideas/inspiration
to exceed all expectations/to come as a surprise
to set/to designate/to stipulate/to provide/to draw up/to formulate (rules etc)/stipulation
to take care of a matter all by oneself/to run the whole show
